item.title: Use Firebug's console.debug Command to Analyze Javascript, DOM Objects
item.author: toby.marks@infolob.com (Toby Marks)
item.description: Occasionally when debugging my Javascript code I need to be able to analyze the properties of an unknown object; for instance, an unexpected DOM object passed to an event handler. How do you analyze the properties of an object when you don’t know what the object is? I was looking for a way to list all the properties of a generic Javascript or DOM object when I stumbled across this blog post by Andrew Peters.
